dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 1773 IH: Federal Firearms Licensee Protection Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Rutherford (for himself, Mr. Golden of Maine, Mr. Estes, Ms. Tenney, Mr. Bost, Mr. LaLota, Mr. Bean of Florida, Mr. Rose, Mr. Finstad, Mr. Moore of Alabama, Mr. Burlison, Mr. Moore of Utah, Mr. Guthrie, Mr. Bilirakis, Ms. De La Cruz, Mr. Hill of Arkansas, Mr. Babin, Mr. Kelly of Pennsylvania, Mr. Fleischmann, Mr. Collins, Mr. Rogers of Alabama, Mr. Gooden, Mr. Crenshaw, Mr. Mann, Mr. Owens, Mrs. Hinson, Mr. Alford, Mr. Green of Tennessee, Mr. Womack, Mr. Feenstra, Mr. Rouzer, Mr. Ellzey, Mr. Higgins of Louisiana, Mr. Harris of Maryland, Mr. Langworthy, Mr. Ezell, Mr. Buchanan, Mr. Tony Gonzales of Texas, Mr. Carter of Georgia, Mr. Evans of Colorado, Mr. Moore of North Carolina, Mr. Stauber, Mr. Kustoff, and Mr. Smith of Nebraska) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend chapter 44 of title 18, United States Code, to enhance penalties for theft of a firearm from a Federal firearms licensee.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Federal Firearms Licensee Protection Act of 2025.
Section 924 of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subsection (i) and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: A person who knowingly violates section 922(u), or attempts to do so, shall be fined under this title, imprisoned not more than 20 years, or both.
In the case of a violation described in subparagraph (A) that occurs during the commission of—

clause.text: a burglary, the term of imprisonment shall be not less than 3 years; or
a robbery, the term of imprisonment shall be not less than 5 years.

subparagraph.text: the term burglary means the unlawful entry into, or remaining in, the business premises of a licensed importer, licensed manufacturer, or licensed dealer with the intent to commit a crime; and
the term robbery has the meaning given the term in section 1951(b).

paragraph.text: in subsection (m), by inserting , or attempts to do so, after or licensed collector.
